Articles.Content: I thought this was interesting,it does lead to Earth stuff but may clarify 'Future tech' Unless a country has a booming economy, enough to pay for some of this stuff:

http://www.futuretimeline.net/

Is also a cool website depicting from now until the end of the universe.
Then it hit me.....! I have the best idea EVER!!

I thought this was interesting,it does lead to Earth stuff but may clarify 'Future tech' Unless a country has a booming economy, enough to pay for some of this stuff:

he puts in a 3rd world war, and a year later people are freely travelling, and a few years later we reach 8 billion in pop?

Looks genuine. ;D
Backto best idea evar!!: The IISMS (International Inter-Stellar Manned Ship) International meaning every country could come together, and participate.

Backto best idea evar!!: The IISMS (International Inter-Stellar Manned Ship) International meaning every country could come together, and participate.

I was planning that, but decided I\'d rather not. Maybe if we get the cooperation of every nation (And when Harverster adds celestial bodies) we could go and explore the deep space.

These are the voyages of the KSS Enterprise...

he puts in a 3rd world war, and a year later people are freely travelling, and a few years later we reach 8 billion in pop?

Looks genuine. ;D

Yeah, the prediction contains too much chaos intertwined with progress.

I was planning that, but decided I\'d rather not. Maybe if we get the cooperation of every nation (And when Harverster adds celestial bodies) we could go and explore the deep space.

These are the voyages of the KSS Enterprise...

We have to get started some time, eh? I think we could keep a persistence throughout updates, the first modules will be docked with landing legs, then in 0.15, we will start docking normally...

I thought this was interesting,it does lead to Earth stuff but may clarify 'Future tech' Unless a country has a booming economy, enough to pay for some of this stuff:

I have a problem with the AI...

I don\'t think that will happen.

I have a problem with the AI...

I don\'t think that will happen.

The plausibility declines rapidly because events are like branches off a tree, this system can only consider one branch, and thus becomes extremely different than reality if just one event is wrong early on.

Also, personally, i believe you shouldn\'t sit and delve on the future, but instead shape it.

I read James\' article (my name is James, and I have been taught to not have the added s on the end of James\'), and though its quite realistic, I could push a few of the software stuff back a bit. But, I would also expect to have met an alien by the time I die (and would like to, I mean, learning about a new species when there is nothing else to find out about). Mostly the problems of long life is though we edit ourselves to do this, what we gain in knowledge and incite we lose in stress and the ability to take it. I personally have hope for the future, and this has gotten me out of some tight spots, but having 200 years of stressful situations? Not fun.

The second thing is with the AI. It will eventually get to the stage a bit later than anyone thinks, but will be able to write its own code, which while not needing a person to create the code for them, the challanges of having the AI never remove the code that controls them is a major problem. Quantum computing is needed also for true AI.

There is several other things that would be nice to talk about, but I can\'t find the words. But, as soon as there is interstellar travil, Im on the first shuttle off this place. Because while there is enough here, I can\'t be bother dealing with humans now let alone dealing with humans with AI components.
[mod]Moved to offtopic, far too OOC for the RP.[/mod]
